c74object.name: el.player~
c74object.description: el.player~is a reentrant, click-triggered soundfile player. A note is triggered by a non-zero click in the left inlet. There are two modes of play. In static mode, the increment received in the right inlet at the time of the click trigger will be the increment for the duration of the note. In dynamic mode the increment can be continuously varied in the left inlet. The playback mode is an attribute.

objarg.name: buffer name
objarg.description: The buffer to read from. It may have any number of channels.

objarg.name: channel count
objarg.description: Number of channels in target buffer. Default is 2.

objarg.name: maximum overlaps
objarg.description: Number of simultaneous playbacks allowed. As long as this is not exceeded by the attempted number of active notes, there will be no clicks when a new note starts; all currently active notes will play to the end of the buffer. Default is 2. This should be set much larger if you want a lot of overlaps, for example, through playing a drum sample repeatedly in a flam.

method.name: paranoia
method.description: Tries to make the external a bit safer when switching buffers at the cost of about double the CPU. Off by default.

method.name: stop
method.description: Immediately stop all currently playing notes.

attribute.name: Static Increment
attribute.description: When this attribute is on, the increment is set for each note at the outset (in the right inlet) and remains constant for the duration of the note. When the attribute is off, the increment can be continuously manipulated, but is the same for all active notes.
